subject: England's batsmen had made the pitch look awkward, with suggestions of uneven bounce.
body:
The National Trust, which owns the property at 
Higher Bockhampton, said it had "decided not to move forward with the holiday let 
proposal". Rhodes version: "No way Smith can make his century here, and that'll hurt 
him. He was finally traced to a badger sett, but owner Stephen Walling said he had 
to wait for permission from countryside wardens before disturbing the area. It was 
only on the floor for three seconds though.
That's about as bad as it gets for Pietersen - 
snagged by his arch-enemy, bowled by The Stare - and England are on the 
ropes.
